Hismith Quad Fucker Kliclok Adpater There’s so much to cover with a fucking machine like this that even when we’re done there are still aspects and angles that I feel like we didn’t get to cover in-depth. The […]
item.content:encoded:
Quad Fucker Sex Machine by Hismith

by Matthew Nolan on 03/23/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Dildos »
  • Kink & BDSM Toys »
  • Kinks »
  • Review Comics

Aka the Hismith Premium Quad Penetration Sex Machine.

This is a delightful four-hole-fucking-machine addition to any household.

  • Hismith Quad Fucker
  • Kliclok Adpater

There’s so much to cover with a fucking machine like this that even when we’re done there are still aspects and angles that I feel like we didn’t get to cover in-depth. The skinny of it? We frigging love this thing, but I have no idea how often we’ll have reason to use it. Maybe something to consider bringing for all the future post-Covid sex parties we’ll be sure to have? 0_o

How is it when there are two people attached to it at one time? Well, as much as we tried, we just couldn’t make that magic happen.

How ARE their Kliclok dildos? Perfectly average! We didn’t love ’em nor hate ’em. We just reached for our fav toys after a little bit of trying.

Why didn’t you like the masturbation sleeve? The material of the toy was unappealing and greasy, but you had to get up and adjust so often that it wasn’t -fun-.

Is the Kliclok system a deal-breaker? Nah, the adapter is almost a must-get to make the machine more universal. But even without it, I’m sure you can customize a toy or two to work with the Kliclok system and rods.

Did you try the App? Nope! We’re not keen on the idea of our privacy eventually being leaked through one of these online-toy-features – so we try to stay away from any ‘online’ toy functions when there’s a physical switch alternative!

All things said and done, if you’ve got a lot of cash, this is the best sex machine we’ve ever tried.

Previous fuck machine reviews:
– LoveGlider/MonkeyRocker
– Moterbunny/Symbian
– Pro 3 Fuck Machine

└ Tags: cock, dick, dildo, fuck machine, fucking machine, his smith, hismith, machine, quad, quad fucker, quadruple, review, sex machine, toy

Rachel Semenov is here delivering an amazing comic about her post-birth body.

It’s honest, it’s open, it’s helpful, and we love it. I know you will, too.

  • Portfolio

While we don’t have any reviews to any specific dilator sets (though, another guest artist, Naomi, covered her experiences with dilation here), we trust the heck out of Early to Bed’s curation. If you’re looking to pick up a set, start there!

Additional reading:
Learn about Pregnancy. Then take a peek at Boum’s comics: Pregnancy Sex and Sex and Breastfeeding.

—-

Finally, LET’S TALK ABOUT IT IS OUT TODAY!
Sex Education and helpful comic on how to communicate and be a good human. Read our spotlight comic about it or just go and pick one up!
If you already got a copy, a review on your fav book-reviewing-site would be awesome too (but zero pressure).

item.title: Let’s Talk About It – Spotlight
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Let’s Talk About It is coming out next freaking week on March 9th from Random House Graphic and it really helps a book’s success if it has a strong pre-order turnout. The better numbers a book debuts with, the more The Algorithms will get it in front of more eyeballs, which means, hopefully, more teens […]
item.content:encoded:
Let’s Talk About It – Spotlight

by Matthew Nolan on 03/02/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Favorites »
  • Literature »
  • Review Comics

Let’s Talk About It is coming out next freaking week on March 9th from Random House Graphic and it really helps a book’s success if it has a strong pre-order turnout. The better numbers a book debuts with, the more The Algorithms will get it in front of more eyeballs, which means, hopefully, more teens could wind up with a copy that helps them make informed decisions about sex, relationships, and being a human. One hopes.

You can ask your fav book shop or library to reserve you a copy, or you can place an order online here with our affiliate links below:

  • Amazon
  • Powell’s
  • Bookshop.org

Now, obviously I’m gunna be all “buy my book” because, y’know, what am I gunna say? “Don’t buy my book”? I may be too biased to be trusted when it comes to recommending my own book, but I CAN direct you towards a couple of impartial establishments who have also read it and liked it enough that they each gave it a coveted starred review: Kirkus and Publishers Weekly. (It’s actually kind of a big deal to get a star from them)

I dunno, man. What are you going to believe? The recommendations of professional book-reviewing institutions or your own eyes?


I rest my case, your honor.

└ Tags: book, graphic novel, let's talk about it, Let'sTalkAboutIt, LTAI, random house, random house graphic, randomhouse, sex education, teens, young adult

item.content:encoded:

by Matthew Nolan on 02/09/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Guest Smutty Comics »

Let’s start Valentine’s day week off with a BANG. Today’s amazing NSFW comic is all the right mix of education, goofs, and porn – by CoffeeSoda! I hope you all love it as much as we do. CoffeeSoda went above and beyond with it, and we couldn’t be more thankful to get such n fun comic on deep-throating.

Make sure to go say hello and, if you’re feeling generous, do back them on Patreon.

  • Twitter
  • FurAffinity
  • Patreon
  • Yiff.Zone (Commissions)

As with any kind of sexy act that can be even a little bit dangerous – we highly recommend any of you interested in deepthroating to do more research than just today’s comic. Erika and I added in some notes at the end of the comic (copy n pasted below) on some bits that aren’t really covered too deeply in the comic, but it’s still only the tip of the iceberg – so do some more googling before you go swallowing footlong-dongs.

Erika and Matt Safety Notes
– If you practice deepthroating on a toy, make sure it has a wiiiide base so you won’t accidentally gobble it up or choke!
– Deep Throating should never hurt – stop if you ever feel pain.
– Listen to your body and stop to breathe when you need to!

Finally, Deepthroating isn’t for everyone, and isn’t the only way to suck dick! Check out our comic from a few years back on more ways to suck the D!

Atmospheric, human, and lovely look at the longing of our imaginations and the reality of actually being alone with your crush. A slice of life that I feel like we’ve all […]
item.content:encoded:
Build Up by BonerBob

by Matthew Nolan on 02/02/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Smutty Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics

We’re in the lead up to Valentine’s 2021, time to start gettin’ romantic.

Today BonerBob is here with a sweet tease of a comic. Atmospheric, human, and lovely look at the longing of our imaginations and the reality of actually being alone with your crush. A slice of life that I feel like we’ve all been through, maybe even more so during the quarantine.
I hope you all enjoy it! Do make sure to go say hello to BonerBob on their social. They’re currently working on another comic for us that I think is an absolute delight.

  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Next week we’ve got a smuttier comic to really land the valentines with. After that, it’s open sky. Erika and I are gonna get a few reviews done and, hopefully, I’ll have a few guests hand in some comics. A reminder that we’re always hiring for comics!

If you’re looking for last minute sexy gifts for Valentines, check out our Best-of-2020 Comic here!

item.title: The Stress Response Cycle
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: “How to De-stress” on Women’s Health Magazine goes more in-depth with some of the methods you can use to complete the stress cycle. God only knows I’m trying my best when I summarize big concepts into simplified comics and my Cliff Notes version is bound to come up short to the original theory, so I […]
item.content:encoded:
The Stress Response Cycle

by Erika Moen on 01/26/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health »
  • Literature

“How to De-stress” on Women’s Health Magazine goes more in-depth with some of the methods you can use to complete the stress cycle. God only knows I’m trying my best when I summarize big concepts into simplified comics and my Cliff Notes version is bound to come up short to the original theory, so I really truly encourage everyone to read my source material for yourself by picking up a copy of Emily and Amelia Nagoski’s book:

  • Burnout @ Amazon
  • Burnout @ Powells
  • Burnout @ Bookshop

Or you can listen to them talk about their book and the stress response cycle, too! Watch them at XOXO Fest, listen to their podcast: Feminist Survival Project 2020, or listen to them talk about it with Brené Brown on her podcast Unlocking Us.

If you are thinking to yourself, hmm, this Emily person sounds familiar…? that is because she and her brilliant work have popped up more than once in some previous OJST comics!
► The Science of Desire (Guest comic illustrated by Rich Stevens)
► Come as You Are Book review (spoilers, we love it)
► A Version of the Sexual Response Cycle (based on Dr. Nagoski’s book on the same subject)

└ Tags: baseline, burn out, Burnout, emily nagoski, responce, Stress response cycle, stressor, Stressresponsecycle
